svt_i2c_master_agent Class Reference

Inheritance diagram for class svt_i2c_master_agent:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

I2C Master Agent

The master agent encapsulates master sequencer, master driver, and master monitor. The master agent can be configured to operate in active mode and passive mode. The user can provide I2C master sequences to the master sequencer. The master agent is configured using the configuration svt_i2c_agent_configuration. The configuration should be provided to the master agent in the build phase of the test. Within the master agent, the master driver gets sequences from the master sequencer. The master driver then drives the I2C master transactions on the I2C bus. After the transaction on the bus is complete, the completed sequence item is provided to the analysis port of port monitor, which can be used by the testbench.

Member Attribute Documentation

 svt_i2c_master  attribute
 svt_i2c_master_agent::driver

I2C Driver. The driver is connected to sequencer. This class consumes all the transactions received from sequencer. It's main responsiblity is to decode the transaction object received from sequencer and drives the transaction on I2C bus (vif). The events available at the master driver are as follows :

  • EVENT_START_GENERATED : signals START condition from master
  • EVENT_STOP_GENERATED : signals STOP condition from master
  • EVENT_ACK_GENERATED : signals generating ACK from master
  • EVENT_NACK_GENERATED : signals generating NACK from master
  • EVENT_ACK_RECEIVED : signals receiving ACK by master
  • EVENT_NACK_RECEIVED : signals receiving NACK by master
  • EVENT_REPEATED_START_GENERATED : signals REPEATED START condition
  • EVENT_START_BYTE_TRANSMITED : signals START BYTE from master
  • EVENT_GENERAL_CALL_ADDR_SENT : signals GENERAL CALL command address sent from master
  • EVENT_GENERAL_CALL_SEC_BYTE_SENT : signals GENERAL CALL command second byte sent from master
  • EVENT_ARBITRATION_LOSS_DETECTED : signals losing arbitration by master

 svt_i2c_err_check  attribute
 svt_i2c_master_agent::err_check

Checker rule handle for VIP Protocol Checker rules

 svt_i2c_master_monitor  attribute
 svt_i2c_master_agent::monitor

I2C System Monitor. This class monitors the port signals and creates a response object for the activities occuring on I2C bus. After transaction is completed on bus it broadcasts the response object to the analysis port for scoreboarding & protocol analyzer usage. It also performs the protocol checks & provides mechanism to enable/disable the error checks, or to promote/ demote the message level for error checks. The events available at the master monitor are as follows :

  • EVENT_START_CONDITION : signals START condition from master
  • EVENT_STOP_CONDITION : signals STOP condition from master
  • EVENT_ACK_RECEIVED : signals receiving ACK on bus
  • EVENT_NACK_RECEIVED : signals receiving NACK on bus
  • EVENT_START_BYTE : signals START BYTE from master
  • EVENT_GEN_CALL : signals GENERAL CALL command from master
  • EVENT_SLAVE_ADD_7_B : signals 7-bit slave address from master
  • EVENT_SLAVE_ADD_10_B : signals 10-bit slave address from master
  • EVENT_GET_PACKET : signals receiving a data byte on bus
  • EVENT_REPEATED_START_CONDITION : signals REPEATED START condition

 svt_i2c_master_transaction_sequencer  attribute
 svt_i2c_master_agent::sequencer

I2C Sequencer The sequencer is connected to driver. This class serves as an arbiter for controlling transaction flow from multiple stimulus generators. It controls the flow of svt_i2c_master_transaction objects generated by test sequences, and pass the transaction objects to driver

 svt_i2c_master_agent::vif

I2C Bus Interface. It includes the top level I2C Bus interface which contains I2C Bus protocol signals
